sen.j: 設楽 貞雄（しだら さだお、1864年7月3日 - 1943年12月15日）は、明治時代から昭和初期にかけて関西で活躍した民間建築家。
sen.e: Sadao SHIDARA (設楽 貞雄,July 3, 1864 - December 15, 1943) was a private architect who was active in Kansai from the Meiji era to the early Showa era.
Sadao SHIDARA (July 3, 1864 - December 15, 1943) was a private architect in Kansai from the Meiji era to the early Showa era.
sen.cmt: 漢字名をけしました。active消しました。
sen.e: Sadao SHIDARA (July 3, 1864 - December 15, 1943) was a private architect in Kansai from the Meiji era to the early Showa era.

sen.j: 大正初期に大阪の新名所となった新世界の建築計画及び通天閣（初代、現在のものとは異なる）の設計などで知られる。
sen.e: He is known for the building plan of Shin Sekai (New World) which became a new place of interest in Osaka in the early Taisho era as well as the designing of the Tsutenkaku Tower (the first one, which was different from the present one).
sen.cmt: 下2行のテキストをこの文の末尾に結合しました。その上で「初代」の後の「。」を「、」に変更し、「異なる」の後の「。」を削除しました。
sen.e: He is known for constructing the building plans for Shin Sekai (New World), which became a well known landmark in Osaka in the early Taisho era, as well as designing the Tsutenkaku Tower (the first one, different from the present one).
sen.cmt: new place of interest を landmark に改訳
sen.e: He is known for constructing the building plans for Shin Sekai (New World), which became a well known landmark in Osaka in the early Taisho era, as well as designing the Tsutenkaku Tower (the first one, different from the present one).

sen.j: 1864年（元治1年）福島県安達郡本宮町 (福島県)（現本宮市）に、二本松藩士・設楽弥兵衛の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: 1864: He was born as the second son of Yahei SHIDARA, a feudal retainer of the Nihonmatsu clan, in Motomiya Town (present-day Motomiya City), Adachi County, Fukushima Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 町名と市名の「本宮」の読みを「もとみや」に統一しました。
sen.e: 1864: He was born as the second son of Yahei SHIDARA, a feudal retainer of the Nihonmatsu clan, in Motomiya Town (present-day Motomiya City), Adachi County, Fukushima Prefecture.
1864: He was born as the second son of Yahei SHIDARA, a feudal retainer of the Nihonmatsu clan, in Motomiya Town (present-day Motomiya City), Adachi County, Fukushima Prefecture.

sen.j: （その後、父は戊辰戦争で戦死。）
sen.e: (Then, his father was killed in the Boshin War.)
sen.cmt: 下の行のテキストをこの文の末尾に結合しました。
sen.e: (Later, his father was killed in the Boshin War.)
sen.cmt: laterの方がなんとなくいいかと
sen.e: (Later, his father was killed in the Boshin War.)

sen.j: 1888年（明治21年）工手学校造家学科に第１期生として入学。
sen.e: 1888: He entered Architecture Department of Koshu School as a student of the first year.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「工学院大学」をWeb原稿に合わせて「工手学校」に訂正しました（さもないと、次の卒業の記事と合わなくなります）。
sen.e: 1888: He entered Architecture Department of Koshu School among its first class of students.
sen.cmt: as a student of the first year だと一年生と勘違いされるので改訳
sen.e: 1888: He entered Architecture Department of Koshu School among its first class of students.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）工手学校造家学科を卒業。
sen.e: 1889: He graduated from Architecture Department of Koshu School.
1889: He graduated from the Architecture Department of Koshu School.
1889: He graduated from the Architecture Department of Koshu School.

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年）日本土木会社に入社。
sen.e: 1891: He entered Nippon Doboku Gaisha (Japan civil engineering company).
1891: He joined the Nippon Doboku Gaisha (Japan civil engineering company).
1891: He joined the Nippon Doboku Gaisha (Japan civil engineering company).

sen.j: 1892年（明治25年）宮内省内匠寮に出仕。
sen.e: 1892: He entered government service in Naishoryo (Bureau of Skilled Artisans) of Kunaisho (Imperial Household Ministry).
1892: He entered government service in Naishoryo (Bureau of Skilled Artisans) of Kunaisho (Imperial Household Ministry).
1892: He entered government service in Naishoryo (Bureau of Skilled Artisans) of Kunaisho (Imperial Household Ministry).

sen.j: 帝室京都博物館の現場を受け持つ。
sen.e: He took charge of a site in the Imperial Kyoto National Museum.
He took charge of a site in the Imperial Kyoto National Museum.
He took charge of a site in the Imperial Kyoto National Museum.

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）桑原政工業事務所に招かれ、山口半六の下で働く。
sen.e: 1896: He was invited to Kuwabara Sei Kogyo Jimusho (Sei KUWABARA Industrial Office) and worked under Hanroku YAMAGUCHI.
1896: He was invited to Kuwabara Sei Kogyo Jimusho (Sei KUWABARA Industrial Office) and worked under Hanroku YAMAGUCHI.
1896: He was invited to Kuwabara Sei Kogyo Jimusho (Sei KUWABARA Industrial Office) and worked under Hanroku YAMAGUCHI.

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年）山口半六事務所の支配人兼所長代理。
sen.e: 1899: He became Manager and Deputy Director of Yamaguchi Hanroku Jimusho (Hanroku YAMAGUCHI Office).
1899: He became Manager and Deputy Director of Yamaguchi Hanroku Jimusho (Hanroku YAMAGUCHI Office).
1899: He became Manager and Deputy Director of Yamaguchi Hanroku Jimusho (Hanroku YAMAGUCHI Office).

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）山陽鉄道株式会社の建築係長。
sen.e: 1900: He became Construction Sub-section Manager of Sanyo Railway Company, Ltd.
1900: He became the Construction Sub-section Manager of Sanyo Railway Company, Ltd.
1900: He became the Construction Sub-section Manager of Sanyo Railway Company, Ltd.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）神戸建築事務所（のち、設楽建築工務所）設立。
sen.e: 1907: He established Kobe Kenchiku Jimusho (Kobe Building Office) (later Shidara Kenchiku Komusho [Shidara Building Company]).
1907: He established Kobe Kenchiku Jimusho (Kobe Building Office) (later Shidara Kenchiku Komusho [Shidara Building Company]).
1907: He established Kobe Kenchiku Jimusho (Kobe Building Office) (later Shidara Kenchiku Komusho [Shidara Building Company]).

sen.j: 1911年（明治44年）大阪土地建物会社顧問となり、新世界娯楽場計画に参画。
sen.e: 1911: He became an adviser of Osaka Tochi Tatemono Gaisha (Osaka Land and Building Company), and took part in Shin Sekai Amusement Grounds Plan.
1911: He became a consultant for the Osaka Tochi Tatemono Gaisha (Osaka Land and Building Company), and took part in the Shin Sekai Amusement Grounds Plan.
1911: He became a consultant for the Osaka Tochi Tatemono Gaisha (Osaka Land and Building Company), and took part in the Shin Sekai Amusement Grounds Plan.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）ヨーロッパ視察旅行。
sen.e: 1928: He went on a inspection tour in Europe.
1928: He went on a inspection tour in Europe.
1928: He went on a inspection tour in Europe.

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年）設楽建築工務所を閉鎖。
sen.e: 1933: He closed down Shidara Kenchiku Komusho.
1933: He closed down Shidara Kenchiku Komusho.
1933: He closed down Shidara Kenchiku Komusho.

sen.j: 1936年（昭和11年）日本建築協会副会長。
sen.e: 1936: He was appointed as a Vice-chairman of Architectural Association of Japan.
1936: He was appointed as a Vice-chairman of Architectural Association of Japan.
1936: He was appointed as a Vice-chairman of Architectural Association of Japan.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）神戸・須磨の自邸で逝去。
sen.e: 1943: He died at his own house in Suma, Kobe.
1943: He died at his home in Suma, Kobe.
1943: He died at his home in Suma, Kobe.

sen.j: 初期の作品は、セセッション色の強い斬新さの感じられる造形が特徴である（例 大阪堂島米穀取引所、有沢眼科医院）が、ややもすると破綻一歩手前という危うさもある。
sen.e: His early works are characterized by the art and design that makes people feel novelty with strong tendency of secession (for example, the Osaka Dojima Rice Exchange and Arisawa Ophthalmic Clinic), but they involve also a danger that they are almost liable to fall through.

His early works are characterized by innovative art and design with a strong secession (an artistic movement in Germany during the 19th century) influence (for example, the Osaka Dojima Rice Exchange and Arisawa Ophthalmic Clinic), but are prone to collapsing.

His early works are characterized by innovative art and design with a strong secession (an artistic movement in Germany during the 19th century) influence (for example, the Osaka Dojima Rice Exchange and Arisawa Ophthalmic Clinic), but are prone to collapsing.

sen.j: しかしながら、新世界通天閣では、エッフェル塔式の鉄塔の設計に当たって設楽の遠縁で鉄道技師の八田嘉明を構造担当に迎えるなど、要所を押さえる仕事振りが目立つ。
sen.e: However, as for Shin Sekai Tsutenkaku Tower, it was remarkable how he worked covering the key points: for example, when he designed a steel tower with a style of the Effel Tower, he employed a railway engineer Yoshiaki HATTA who was a distant relative of Shidara as a person in charge of the structure.

However, with the Shin Sekai Tsutenkaku Tower, he concentrated key points like being faithful to the style of the Effel Tower; for this task, he employed Yoshiaki HATTA, a distant relative and a railway engineer, as a person in charge of the structure.

However, with the Shin Sekai Tsutenkaku Tower, he concentrated key points like being faithful to the style of the Effel Tower; for this task, he employed Yoshiaki HATTA, a distant relative and a railway engineer, as a person in charge of the structure.

sen.j: 大正時代に入り、名古屋高等工業専門学校や京都帝国大学出身の所員が入所するようになって以降、ルネッサンススタイルなど古典系の堅実な造形が多くなる（例 内田汽船本社、旧三十八銀行本店）。
sen.e: In the Taisho era, since the graduates from Nagoya Advanced Technical College or Kyoto Imperial University began to enter his company, he had produced more works of the classical and steady art and design such as Renaissance style than ever (for example, the headquarters of Uchida Kisen and the head office of the former Thirty-Eighth Bank).

In the Taisho era, since the graduates from Nagoya Advanced Technical College and Kyoto Imperial University began to enter his company, he began to produce more works of classical and stable designs like the Renaissance style(for example, the headquarters of Uchida Kisen and the head office of the former Thirty-Eighth Bank).

In the Taisho era, since the graduates from Nagoya Advanced Technical College and Kyoto Imperial University began to enter his company, he began to produce more works of classical and stable designs like the Renaissance style(for example, the headquarters of Uchida Kisen and the head office of the former Thirty-Eighth Bank).

sen.j: 住宅では、初期の木造系の作品（例 大日本セルロイド網干工場外国人技師住宅）は、セセッションを加味したコロニアルスタイルであった。
sen.e: In the case of houses, his early wooden works (for example, a house for a foreign engineer of the Amiboshi factory of Dai-nippon Celluloid) were of colonial styles with a flavor of secession.
In the case of houses, his early wooden works (for example, a house for a foreign engineer of the Amiboshi factory of Dai-nippon Celluloid) were of colonial styles with a flavor of secession.
In the case of houses, his early wooden works (for example, a house for a foreign engineer of the Amiboshi factory of Dai-nippon Celluloid) were of colonial styles with a flavor of secession.

sen.j: この中で村野山人邸は、近年発掘された写真帖から、洋館部のインテリア（例：階段親柱、暖炉、家具類など）にアールヌーボーデザインを大いに取り入れるなど意欲的な作品であったことが判明した。
sen.e: Among these, the Sanjin MURANO residence turned out to be an ambitious work, for the photograph album which was discovered recently has made it clear that Shidara adopted art nouveau design on a large scale into the interior decoration of the Western-style house part (for example, the newel posts of the stairs, the fireplace, and the articles of furniture).

From a recently discovered photo album, it can be seen that among the houses he designed, the Sanjin MURANO residence was an ambitious work which included an art nouveau interior (examples: the newel posts of the stairs, the fireplace, and the furniture).
sen.cmt: 文の順並び替えました。長い所は省略
sen.e: From a recently discovered photo album, it can be seen that among the houses he designed, the Sanjin MURANO residence was an ambitious work which included an art nouveau interior (examples: the newel posts of the stairs, the fireplace, and the furniture).

sen.j: 大正時代に入って旧岡崎家住宅、旧西尾家住宅などセセッション色を押し出した大規模な洋館や、沢野邸などの和洋折衷の鉄筋コンクリート造住宅、沢田邸、内田信也邸和館を始めとする御殿風の和風邸宅まで、多様なレパートリーを誇った。
sen.e: In the Taisho era, he took pride in a large repertory of works from the large-scale Western-style houses in which the tendency of secession was emphasized like the former Okazaki family house and the former Nishio family house, and the reinforced concrete houses of semi-Western style such as the Sawano residence, to the Japanese style residences with a flavor of Goten (palace) including the Sawada residence and the Japanese house of the Shinya UCHIDA residence.

In the Taisho era, he accumulated a large repertory of works from the large-scale Western-style houses with secession emphasis like the former Okazaki family house and the former Nishio family house, and the reinforced concrete houses of semi-Western style such as the Sawano residence, to the Japanese style residences with a flavor of Goten (palace) including the Sawada residence and the Japanese house of the Shinya UCHIDA residence.
sen.cmt: 誇るの直訳をaccumulatedに改訳。secession tendency was emphasized ---> secession emphasis
sen.e: In the Taisho era, he accumulated a large repertory of works from the large-scale Western-style houses with secession emphasis like the former Okazaki family house and the former Nishio family house, and the reinforced concrete houses of semi-Western style such as the Sawano residence, to the Japanese style residences with a flavor of Goten (palace) including the Sawada residence and the Japanese house of the Shinya UCHIDA residence.
